BatchUpdateRule.name: BatchUpdateRule
BatchUpdateRule.documentation:
Updates the listener rules in a batch. You can use this operation to change the priority of listener rules. This can be useful when bulk updating or swapping rule priority.

Required permissions: vpc-lattice:UpdateRule

For more information, see How Amazon VPC Lattice works with IAM in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

CreateAccessLogSubscription.name: CreateAccessLogSubscription
CreateAccessLogSubscription.documentation: Enables access logs to be sent to Amazon CloudWatch, Amazon S3, and Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose. The service network owner can use the access logs to audit the services in the network. The service network owner can only see access logs from clients and services that are associated with their service network. Access log entries represent traffic originated from VPCs associated with that network. For more information, see Access logs in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

CreateListener.name: CreateListener
CreateListener.documentation: Creates a listener for a service. Before you start using your Amazon VPC Lattice service, you must add one or more listeners. A listener is a process that checks for connection requests to your services. For more information, see Listeners in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

CreateResourceConfiguration.name: CreateResourceConfiguration
CreateResourceConfiguration.documentation: Creates a resource configuration. A resource configuration defines a specific resource. You can associate a resource configuration with a service network or a VPC endpoint.

CreateRule.name: CreateRule
CreateRule.documentation: Creates a listener rule. Each listener has a default rule for checking connection requests, but you can define additional rules. Each rule consists of a priority, one or more actions, and one or more conditions. For more information, see Listener rules in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

CreateService.name: CreateService
CreateService.documentation:
Creates a service. A service is any software application that can run on instances containers, or serverless functions within an account or virtual private cloud (VPC).

For more information, see Services in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

CreateServiceNetwork.name: CreateServiceNetwork
CreateServiceNetwork.documentation:
Creates a service network. A service network is a logical boundary for a collection of services. You can associate services and VPCs with a service network.

For more information, see Service networks in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

CreateServiceNetworkResourceAssociation.name: CreateServiceNetworkResourceAssociation
CreateServiceNetworkResourceAssociation.documentation: Associates the specified service network with the specified resource configuration. This allows the resource configuration to receive connections through the service network, including through a service network VPC endpoint.

CreateServiceNetworkServiceAssociation.name: CreateServiceNetworkServiceAssociation
CreateServiceNetworkServiceAssociation.documentation:
Associates the specified service with the specified service network. For more information, see Manage service associations in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

You can't use this operation if the service and service network are already associated or if there is a disassociation or deletion in progress. If the association fails, you can retry the operation by deleting the association and recreating it.

You cannot associate a service and service network that are shared with a caller. The caller must own either the service or the service network.

As a result of this operation, the association is created in the service network account and the association owner account.

CreateServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.name: CreateServiceNetworkVpcAssociation
CreateServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.documentation:
Associates a VPC with a service network. When you associate a VPC with the service network, it enables all the resources within that VPC to be clients and communicate with other services in the service network. For more information, see Manage VPC associations in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

You can't use this operation if there is a disassociation in progress. If the association fails, retry by deleting the association and recreating it.

As a result of this operation, the association gets created in the service network account and the VPC owner account.

If you add a security group to the service network and VPC association, the association must continue to always have at least one security group. You can add or edit security groups at any time. However, to remove all security groups, you must first delete the association and recreate it without security groups.

CreateTargetGroup.name: CreateTargetGroup
CreateTargetGroup.documentation:
Creates a target group. A target group is a collection of targets, or compute resources, that run your application or service. A target group can only be used by a single service.

For more information, see Target groups in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

DeleteAuthPolicy.name: DeleteAuthPolicy
DeleteAuthPolicy.documentation: Deletes the specified auth policy. If an auth is set to AWS_IAM and the auth policy is deleted, all requests are denied. If you are trying to remove the auth policy completely, you must set the auth type to NONE. If auth is enabled on the resource, but no auth policy is set, all requests are denied.

DeleteResourceEndpointAssociation.name: DeleteResourceEndpointAssociation
DeleteResourceEndpointAssociation.documentation: Disassociates the resource configuration from the resource VPC endpoint.

DeleteRule.name: DeleteRule
DeleteRule.documentation:
Deletes a listener rule. Each listener has a default rule for checking connection requests, but you can define additional rules. Each rule consists of a priority, one or more actions, and one or more conditions. You can delete additional listener rules, but you cannot delete the default rule.

For more information, see Listener rules in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

DeleteService.name: DeleteService
DeleteService.documentation: Deletes a service. A service can't be deleted if it's associated with a service network. If you delete a service, all resources related to the service, such as the resource policy, auth policy, listeners, listener rules, and access log subscriptions, are also deleted. For more information, see Delete a service in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

DeleteServiceNetwork.name: DeleteServiceNetwork
DeleteServiceNetwork.documentation: Deletes a service network. You can only delete the service network if there is no service or VPC associated with it. If you delete a service network, all resources related to the service network, such as the resource policy, auth policy, and access log subscriptions, are also deleted. For more information, see Delete a service network in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

DeleteServiceNetworkResourceAssociation.name: DeleteServiceNetworkResourceAssociation
DeleteServiceNetworkResourceAssociation.documentation: Deletes the association between a service network and a resource configuration.

DeleteServiceNetworkServiceAssociation.name: DeleteServiceNetworkServiceAssociation
DeleteServiceNetworkServiceAssociation.documentation: Deletes the association between a service and a service network. This operation fails if an association is still in progress.

DeleteServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.name: DeleteServiceNetworkVpcAssociation
DeleteServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.documentation: Disassociates the VPC from the service network. You can't disassociate the VPC if there is a create or update association in progress.

DeleteTargetGroup.name: DeleteTargetGroup
DeleteTargetGroup.documentation: Deletes a target group. You can't delete a target group if it is used in a listener rule or if the target group creation is in progress.

DeregisterTargets.name: DeregisterTargets
DeregisterTargets.documentation: Deregisters the specified targets from the specified target group.

GetAccessLogSubscription.name: GetAccessLogSubscription
GetAccessLogSubscription.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified access log subscription.

GetAuthPolicy.name: GetAuthPolicy
GetAuthPolicy.documentation: Retrieves information about the auth policy for the specified service or service network.

GetListener.name: GetListener
GetListener.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified listener for the specified service.

GetResourceConfiguration.name: GetResourceConfiguration
GetResourceConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified resource configuration.

GetResourceGateway.name: GetResourceGateway
GetResourceGateway.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified resource gateway.

GetResourcePolicy.name: GetResourcePolicy
GetResourcePolicy.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified resource policy. The resource policy is an IAM policy created on behalf of the resource owner when they share a resource.

GetRule.name: GetRule
GetRule.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified listener rules. You can also retrieve information about the default listener rule. For more information, see Listener rules in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

GetServiceNetwork.name: GetServiceNetwork
GetServiceNetwork.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified service network.

GetServiceNetworkResourceAssociation.name: GetServiceNetworkResourceAssociation
GetServiceNetworkResourceAssociation.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified association between a service network and a resource configuration.

GetServiceNetworkServiceAssociation.name: GetServiceNetworkServiceAssociation
GetServiceNetworkServiceAssociation.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified association between a service network and a service.

GetServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.name: GetServiceNetworkVpcAssociation
GetServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified association between a service network and a VPC.

GetTargetGroup.name: GetTargetGroup
GetTargetGroup.documentation: Retrieves information about the specified target group.

ListAccessLogSubscriptions.name: ListAccessLogSubscriptions
ListAccessLogSubscriptions.documentation: Lists the access log subscriptions for the specified service network or service.

ListListeners.name: ListListeners
ListListeners.documentation: Lists the listeners for the specified service.

ListResourceConfigurations.name: ListResourceConfigurations
ListResourceConfigurations.documentation: Lists the resource configurations owned by or shared with this account.

ListResourceEndpointAssociations.name: ListResourceEndpointAssociations
ListResourceEndpointAssociations.documentation: Lists the associations for the specified VPC endpoint.

ListResourceGateways.name: ListResourceGateways
ListResourceGateways.documentation: Lists the resource gateways that you own or that were shared with you.

ListRules.name: ListRules
ListRules.documentation: Lists the rules for the specified listener.

ListServiceNetworkResourceAssociations.name: ListServiceNetworkResourceAssociations
ListServiceNetworkResourceAssociations.documentation: Lists the associations between a service network and a resource configuration.

ListServiceNetworkServiceAssociations.name: ListServiceNetworkServiceAssociations
ListServiceNetworkServiceAssociations.documentation:
Lists the associations between a service network and a service. You can filter the list either by service or service network. You must provide either the service network identifier or the service identifier.

Every association in Amazon VPC Lattice has a unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN), such as when a service network is associated with a VPC or when a service is associated with a service network. If the association is for a resource is shared with another account, the association includes the local account ID as the prefix in the ARN.

ListServiceNetworkVpcAssociations.name: ListServiceNetworkVpcAssociations
ListServiceNetworkVpcAssociations.documentation: Lists the associations between a service network and a VPC. You can filter the list either by VPC or service network. You must provide either the ID of the service network identifier or the ID of the VPC.

ListServiceNetworkVpcEndpointAssociation.name: ListServiceNetworkVpcEndpointAssociations
ListServiceNetworkVpcEndpointAssociation.documentation: Lists the associations between a service network and a VPC endpoint.

ListServiceNetworks.name: ListServiceNetworks
ListServiceNetworks.documentation: Lists the service networks owned by or shared with this account. The account ID in the ARN shows which account owns the service network.

ListServices.name: ListServices
ListServices.documentation: Lists the services owned by the caller account or shared with the caller account.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags for the specified resource.

ListTargetGroups.name: ListTargetGroups
ListTargetGroups.documentation: Lists your target groups. You can narrow your search by using the filters below in your request.

ListTargets.name: ListTargets
ListTargets.documentation: Lists the targets for the target group. By default, all targets are included. You can use this API to check the health status of targets. You can also Ô¨Ålter the results by target.

PutAuthPolicy.name: PutAuthPolicy
PutAuthPolicy.documentation:
Creates or updates the auth policy. The policy string in JSON must not contain newlines or blank lines.

For more information, see Auth policies in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

PutResourcePolicy.name: PutResourcePolicy
PutResourcePolicy.documentation: Attaches a resource-based permission policy to a service or service network. The policy must contain the same actions and condition statements as the Amazon Web Services Resource Access Manager permission for sharing services and service networks.

RegisterTargets.name: RegisterTargets
RegisterTargets.documentation: Registers the targets with the target group. If it's a Lambda target, you can only have one target in a target group.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.

UpdateListener.name: UpdateListener
UpdateListener.documentation: Updates the specified listener for the specified service.

UpdateRule.name: UpdateRule
UpdateRule.documentation: Updates a specified rule for the listener. You can't modify a default listener rule. To modify a default listener rule, use UpdateListener.

UpdateServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.name: UpdateServiceNetworkVpcAssociation
UpdateServiceNetworkVpcAssociation.documentation: Updates the service network and VPC association. If you add a security group to the service network and VPC association, the association must continue to have at least one security group. You can add or edit security groups at any time. However, to remove all security groups, you must first delete the association and then recreate it without security groups.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: The user does not have sufficient access to perform this action.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log subscription

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the access log subscription was created, in ISO-8601 format.

destinationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination.

id.documentation: The ID of the access log subscription.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The date and time that the access log subscription was last updated, in ISO-8601 format.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service or service network.

resourceId.documentation: The ID of the service or service network.

AccessLogSubscriptionSummary.documentation: Summary information about an access log subscription.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

ArnResource.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

listenerIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the listener.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

unsuccessful.documentation: The rules that the operation couldn't update.

ConflictException.documentation: The request conflicts with the current state of the resource. Updating or deleting a resource can cause an inconsistent state.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

destinationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination. The supported destination types are CloudWatch Log groups, Kinesis Data Firehose delivery streams, and Amazon S3 buckets.

resourceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service network or service.

serviceNetworkLogType.documentation: The type of log that monitors your Amazon VPC Lattice service networks.

tags.documentation: The tags for the access log subscription.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log subscription.

destinationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log destination.

id.documentation: The ID of the access log subscription.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service network or service.

resourceId.documentation: The ID of the service network or service.

serviceNetworkLogType.documentation: The type of log that monitors your Amazon VPC Lattice service networks.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

defaultAction.documentation: The action for the default rule. Each listener has a default rule. The default rule is used if no other rules match.

name.documentation: The name of the listener. A listener name must be unique within a service. The valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.

port.documentation: The listener port. You can specify a value from 1 to 65535. For HTTP, the default is 80. For HTTPS, the default is 443.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.

serviceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service.

allowAssociationToShareableServiceNetwor.documentation: (SINGLE, GROUP, ARN) Specifies whether the resource configuration can be associated with a sharable service network. The default is false.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

name.documentation: The name of the resource configuration. The name must be unique within the account. The valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.

portRanges.documentation: (SINGLE, GROUP, CHILD) The TCP port ranges that a consumer can use to access a resource configuration (for example: 1-65535). You can separate port ranges using commas (for example: 1,2,22-30).

protocol.documentation: (SINGLE, GROUP) The protocol accepted by the resource configuration.

resourceConfigurationGroupIdentifier.documentation: (CHILD) The ID or ARN of the parent resource configuration (type is GROUP). This is used to associate a child resource configuration with a group resource configuration.

resourceGatewayIdentifier.documentation: (SINGLE, GROUP, ARN) The ID or ARN of the resource gateway used to connect to the resource configuration. For a child resource configuration, this value is inherited from the parent resource configuration.

type.documentation:
The type of resource configuration.

  • SINGLE - A single resource.

  • GROUP - A group of resources. You must create a group resource configuration before you create a child resource configuration.

  • CHILD - A single resource that is part of a group resource configuration.

  • ARN - An Amazon Web Services resource.

allowAssociationToShareableServiceNetwor.documentation: Specifies whether the resource configuration can be associated with a sharable service network.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource configuration.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the resource configuration was created, in ISO-8601 format.

resourceConfigurationGroupId.documentation: The ID of the parent resource configuration (type is GROUP).

resourceGatewayId.documentation: The ID of the resource gateway associated with the resource configuration.

status.documentation: The current status of the resource configuration.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

ipAddressType.documentation: The type of IP address used by the resource gateway.

securityGroupIds.documentation: The IDs of the security groups to apply to the resource gateway. The security groups must be in the same VPC.

subnetIds.documentation: The IDs of the VPC subnets in which to create the resource gateway.

vpcIdentifier.documentation: The ID of the VPC for the resource gateway.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource gateway.

ipAddressType.documentation: The type of IP address for the resource gateway.

securityGroupIds.documentation: The IDs of the security groups for the resource gateway.

subnetIds.documentation: The IDs of the resource gateway subnets.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

listenerIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the listener.

name.documentation: The name of the rule. The name must be unique within the listener. The valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.

priority.documentation: The priority assigned to the rule. Each rule for a specific listener must have a unique priority. The lower the priority number the higher the priority.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rule.

match.documentation: The rule match. The RuleMatch must be an HttpMatch. This means that the rule should be an exact match on HTTP constraints which are made up of the HTTP method, path, and header.

priority.documentation: The priority assigned to the rule. The lower the priority number the higher the priority.

authType.documentation:
The type of IAM policy.

  • NONE: The resource does not use an IAM policy. This is the default.

  • AWS_IAM: The resource uses an IAM policy. When this type is used, auth is enabled and an auth policy is required.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

name.documentation: The name of the service network. The name must be unique to the account. The valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.

sharingConfig.documentation: Specify if the service network should be enabled for sharing.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

resourceConfigurationIdentifier.documentation: The ID of the resource configuration to associate with the service network.

serviceNetworkIdentifier.documentation: The ID of the service network to associate with the resource configuration.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

createdBy.documentation: The ID of the account that created the association.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service network.

sharingConfig.documentation: Specifies if the service network is enabled for sharing.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

serviceNetworkIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service network. You must use an ARN if the resources are in different accounts.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

customDomainName.documentation: The custom domain name of the service.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

securityGroupIds.documentation: The IDs of the security groups. Security groups aren't added by default. You can add a security group to apply network level controls to control which resources in a VPC are allowed to access the service network and its services. For more information, see Control traffic to resources using security groups in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

serviceNetworkIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service network. You must use an ARN if the resources are in different accounts.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

authType.documentation:
The type of IAM policy.

  • NONE: The resource does not use an IAM policy. This is the default.

  • AWS_IAM: The resource uses an IAM policy. When this type is used, auth is enabled and an auth policy is required.

certificateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

customDomainName.documentation: The custom domain name of the service.

name.documentation: The name of the service. The name must be unique within the account. The valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service.

certificateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.

customDomainName.documentation: The custom domain name of the service.

dnsEntry.documentation: The public DNS name of the service.

status.documentation: The status. If the status is CREATE_FAILED, you must delete and recreate the service.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you retry a request that completed successfully using the same client token and parameters, the retry succeeds without performing any actions. If the parameters aren't identical, the retry fails.

name.documentation: The name of the target group. The name must be unique within the account. The valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group.

status.documentation: The status. You can retry the operation if the status is CREATE_FAILED. However, if you retry it while the status is CREATE_IN_PROGRESS, there is no change in the status.

accessLogSubscriptionIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the access log subscription.

resourceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the resource.

listenerIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the listener.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

resourceConfigurationIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the resource configuration.

resourceEndpointAssociationIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the association.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

resourceConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource configuration associated with the VPC endpoint of type resource.

vpcEndpointId.documentation: The ID of the resource VPC endpoint that is associated with the resource configuration.

resourceGatewayIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the resource gateway.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource gateway.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

listenerIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the listener.

ruleIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the rule.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

serviceNetworkIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service network.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

serviceNetworkServiceAssociationIdentifi.documentation: The ID or ARN of the association.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

status.documentation: The status. You can retry the operation if the status is DELETE_FAILED. However, if you retry it when the status is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, there is no change in the status.

serviceNetworkVpcAssociationIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the association.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

status.documentation: The status. You can retry the operation if the status is DELETE_FAILED. However, if you retry it while the status is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, there is no change in the status.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service.

status.documentation: The status. You can retry the operation if the status is DELETE_FAILED. However, if you retry it while the status is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, the status doesn't change.

targetGroupIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the target group.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group.

status.documentation: The status. You can retry the operation if the status is DELETE_FAILED. However, if you retry it while the status is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, the status doesn't change.

targetGroupIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the target group.

unsuccessful.documentation: The targets that the operation couldn't deregister.

DnsEntry.documentation: Describes the DNS information of a service.

FixedResponseAction.documentation: Describes an action that returns a custom HTTP response.

targetGroups.documentation:
The target groups. Traffic matching the rule is forwarded to the specified target groups. With forward actions, you can assign a weight that controls the prioritization and selection of each target group. This means that requests are distributed to individual target groups based on their weights. For example, if two target groups have the same weight, each target group receives half of the traffic.

The default value is 1. This means that if only one target group is provided, there is no need to set the weight; 100% of the traffic goes to that target group.

ForwardAction.documentation: Describes a forward action. You can use forward actions to route requests to one or more target groups.

accessLogSubscriptionIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the access log subscription.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log subscription.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the access log subscription was created, in ISO-8601 format.

destinationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log destination.

id.documentation: The ID of the access log subscription.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The date and time that the access log subscription was last updated, in ISO-8601 format.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service network or service.

resourceId.documentation: The ID of the service network or service.

serviceNetworkLogType.documentation: The log type for the service network.

resourceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service network or service.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the auth policy was created, in ISO-8601 format.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The date and time that the auth policy was last updated, in ISO-8601 format.

state.documentation: The state of the auth policy. The auth policy is only active when the auth type is set to AWS_IAM. If you provide a policy, then authentication and authorization decisions are made based on this policy and the client's IAM policy. If the auth type is NONE, then any auth policy that you provide remains inactive. For more information, see Create a service network in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

listenerIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the listener.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the listener was created, in ISO-8601 format.

defaultAction.documentation: The actions for the default listener rule.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The date and time that the listener was last updated, in ISO-8601 format.

serviceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service.

allowAssociationToShareableServiceNetwor.documentation: Specifies whether the resource configuration is associated with a sharable service network.

amazonManaged.documentation: Indicates whether the resource configuration was created and is managed by Amazon.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource configuration.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the resource configuration was created, in ISO-8601 format.

customDomainName.documentation: The custom domain name of the resource configuration.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The most recent date and time that the resource configuration was updated, in ISO-8601 format.

portRanges.documentation: The TCP port ranges that a consumer can use to access a resource configuration. You can separate port ranges with a comma. Example: 1-65535 or 1,2,22-30

protocol.documentation: The TCP protocol accepted by the specified resource configuration.

resourceConfigurationGroupId.documentation: The ID of the group resource configuration.

resourceGatewayId.documentation: The ID of the resource gateway used to connect to the resource configuration in a given VPC. You can specify the resource gateway identifier only for resource configurations with type SINGLE, GROUP, or ARN.

type.documentation:
The type of resource configuration.

  • SINGLE - A single resource.

  • GROUP - A group of resources.

  • CHILD - A single resource that is part of a group resource configuration.

  • ARN - An Amazon Web Services resource.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource gateway.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the resource gateway was created, in ISO-8601 format.

ipAddressType.documentation: The type of IP address for the resource gateway.

caseSensitive.documentation: Indicates whether the match is case sensitive.

HeaderMatch.documentation: Describes the constraints for a header match. Matches incoming requests with rule based on request header value before applying rule action.

prefix.documentation: A prefix type match. Matches the value with the prefix.

healthCheckIntervalSeconds.documentation: The approximate amount of time, in seconds, between health checks of an individual target. The range is 5‚Äì300 seconds. The default is 30 seconds.

healthCheckTimeoutSeconds.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait before reporting a target as unhealthy. The range is 1‚Äì120 seconds. The default is 5 seconds.

healthyThresholdCount.documentation: The number of consecutive successful health checks required before considering an unhealthy target healthy. The range is 2‚Äì10. The default is 5.

matcher.documentation: The codes to use when checking for a successful response from a target.

path.documentation: The destination for health checks on the targets. If the protocol version is HTTP/1.1 or HTTP/2, specify a valid URI (for example, /path?query). The default path is /. Health checks are not supported if the protocol version is gRPC, however, you can choose HTTP/1.1 or HTTP/2 and specify a valid URI.

port.documentation: The port used when performing health checks on targets. The default setting is the port that a target receives traffic on.

protocol.documentation: The protocol used when performing health checks on targets. The possible protocols are HTTP and HTTPS. The default is HTTP.

protocolVersion.documentation: The protocol version used when performing health checks on targets. The possible protocol versions are HTTP1 and HTTP2.

unhealthyThresholdCount.documentation: The number of consecutive failed health checks required before considering a target unhealthy. The range is 2‚Äì10. The default is 2.

HealthCheckConfig.documentation: Describes the health check configuration of a target group. Health check configurations aren't used for target groups of type LAMBDA or ALB.

headerMatches.documentation: The header matches. Matches incoming requests with rule based on request header value before applying rule action.

HttpMatch.documentation: Describes criteria that can be applied to incoming requests.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds to wait before retrying.

InternalServerException.documentation: An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

policy.documentation: The auth policy. The policy string in JSON must not contain newlines or blank lines.

policy.documentation: The auth policy. The policy string in JSON must not contain newlines or blank lines.

state.documentation: The state of the auth policy. The auth policy is only active when the auth type is set to AWS_IAM. If you provide a policy, then authentication and authorization decisions are made based on this policy and the client's IAM policy. If the Auth type is NONE, then, any auth policy that you provide remains inactive. For more information, see Create a service network in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

policy.documentation: An IAM policy. The policy string in JSON must not contain newlines or blank lines.

  • SINGLE - A single resource.

  • GROUP - A group of resources.

  • CHILD - A single resource that is part of a group resource configuration.

  • ARN - An Amazon Web Services resource.

customDomainName.documentation: The custom domain name of the service.

enabled.documentation: Specifies if the service network is enabled for sharing.

SharingConfig.documentation: Specifies if the service network should be enabled for sharing.

key.documentation:
The key of the tag.

Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 128 Unicode characters. Valid characters are Unicode letters, digits, white space, and any of the following symbols: _ . : / = + - @ May not begin with aws:.

value.documentation:
The value of the tag.

Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters. Valid characters are Unicode letters, digits, white space, and any of the following symbols: _ . : / = + - @

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

id.documentation: The ID of the target. If the target group type is INSTANCE, this is an instance ID. If the target group type is IP, this is an IP address. If the target group type is LAMBDA, this is the ARN of a Lambda function. If the target group type is ALB, this is the ARN of an Application Load Balancer.

port.documentation: The port on which the target is listening. For HTTP, the default is 80. For HTTPS, the default is 443.

id.documentation: The ID of the target. If the target group type is INSTANCE, this is an instance ID. If the target group type is IP, this is an IP address. If the target group type is LAMBDA, this is the ARN of a Lambda function. If the target group type is ALB, this is the ARN of an Application Load Balancer.

port.documentation: The port on which the target is listening. This parameter doesn't apply if the target is a Lambda function.

healthCheck.documentation: The health check configuration. Not supported if the target group type is LAMBDA or ALB.

ipAddressType.documentation: The type of IP address used for the target group. Supported only if the target group type is IP. The default is IPV4.

lambdaEventStructureVersion.documentation: The version of the event structure that your Lambda function receives. Supported only if the target group type is LAMBDA. The default is V1.

port.documentation: The port on which the targets are listening. For HTTP, the default is 80. For HTTPS, the default is 443. Not supported if the target group type is LAMBDA.

protocol.documentation: The protocol to use for routing traffic to the targets. The default is the protocol of the target group. Not supported if the target group type is LAMBDA.

protocolVersion.documentation: The protocol version. The default is HTTP1. Not supported if the target group type is LAMBDA.

vpcIdentifier.documentation: The ID of the VPC. Not supported if the target group type is LAMBDA.

TargetGroupConfig.documentation:
Describes the configuration of a target group.

For more information, see Target groups in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

arn.documentation: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the target group.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the target group was created, in ISO-8601 format.

ipAddressType.documentation: The type of IP address used for the target group. The possible values are IPV4 and IPV6. This is an optional parameter. If not specified, the default is IPV4.

lambdaEventStructureVersion.documentation: The version of the event structure that your Lambda function receives. Supported only if the target group type is LAMBDA.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The date and time that the target group was last updated, in ISO-8601 format.

serviceArns.documentation: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the service.

vpcIdentifier.documentation: The ID of the VPC of the target group.

TargetGroupSummary.documentation:
Summary information about a target group.

For more information, see Target groups in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

id.documentation: The ID of the target. If the target group type is INSTANCE, this is an instance ID. If the target group type is IP, this is an IP address. If the target group type is LAMBDA, this is the ARN of a Lambda function. If the target type is ALB, this is the ARN of an Application Load Balancer.

port.documentation: The port on which the target is listening.

reasonCode.documentation: The code for why the target status is what it is.

status.documentation:
The status of the target.

  • DRAINING: The target is being deregistered. No new connections are sent to this target while current connections are being drained. The default draining time is 5 minutes.

  • UNAVAILABLE: Health checks are unavailable for the target group.

  • HEALTHY: The target is healthy.

  • UNHEALTHY: The target is unhealthy.

  • INITIAL: Initial health checks on the target are being performed.

  • UNUSED: Target group is not used in a service.

quotaCode.documentation: The ID of the service quota that was exceeded.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds to wait before retrying.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The limit on the number of requests per second was exceeded.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

tagKeys.documentation: The tag keys of the tags to remove.

accessLogSubscriptionIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the access log subscription.

destinationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log destination.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log subscription.

destinationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log destination.

id.documentation: The ID of the access log subscription.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access log subscription.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.

allowAssociationToShareableServiceNetwor.documentation: Indicates whether to add the resource configuration to service networks that are shared with other accounts.

portRanges.documentation: The TCP port ranges that a consumer can use to access a resource configuration. You can separate port ranges with a comma. Example: 1-65535 or 1,2,22-30

allowAssociationToShareableServiceNetwor.documentation: Indicates whether to add the resource configuration to service networks that are shared with other accounts.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource configuration.

portRanges.documentation: The TCP port ranges that a consumer can use to access a resource configuration. You can separate port ranges with a comma. Example: 1-65535 or 1,2,22-30

protocol.documentation: The TCP protocol accepted by the specified resource configuration.

resourceConfigurationGroupId.documentation: The ID of the group resource configuration.

resourceGatewayId.documentation: The ID of the resource gateway associated with the resource configuration.

type.documentation:
The type of resource configuration.

  • SINGLE - A single resource.

  • GROUP - A group of resources.

  • CHILD - A single resource that is part of a group resource configuration.

  • ARN - An Amazon Web Services resource.

action.documentation: Information about the action for the specified listener rule.

priority.documentation: The rule priority. A listener can't have multiple rules with the same priority.

ruleIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the rule.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

action.documentation: Information about the action for the specified listener rule.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.

isDefault.documentation: Indicates whether this is the default rule.

authType.documentation:
The type of IAM policy.

  • NONE: The resource does not use an IAM policy. This is the default.

  • AWS_IAM: The resource uses an IAM policy. When this type is used, auth is enabled and an auth policy is required.

serviceNetworkIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service network.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service network.

serviceNetworkVpcAssociationIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the association.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the association.

status.documentation: The status. You can retry the operation if the status is DELETE_FAILED. However, if you retry it while the status is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, there is no change in the status.

authType.documentation:
The type of IAM policy.

  • NONE: The resource does not use an IAM policy. This is the default.

  • AWS_IAM: The resource uses an IAM policy. When this type is used, auth is enabled and an auth policy is required.

certificateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.

serviceIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the service.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service.

certificateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.

customDomainName.documentation: The custom domain name of the service.

targetGroupIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the target group.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group.

ValidationException.documentation: The input does not satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web Services service.

message.documentation: Additional information about why the validation failed.

targetGroupIdentifier.documentation: The ID or ARN of the target group.

weight.documentation: Only required if you specify multiple target groups for a forward action. The weight determines how requests are distributed to the target group. For example, if you specify two target groups, each with a weight of 10, each target group receives half the requests. If you specify two target groups, one with a weight of 10 and the other with a weight of 20, the target group with a weight of 20 receives twice as many requests as the other target group. If there's only one target group specified, then the default value is 100.

WeightedTargetGroup.documentation: Describes the weight of a target group.

documentation: Amazon VPC Lattice is a fully managed application networking service that you use to connect, secure, and monitor all of your services across multiple accounts and virtual private clouds (VPCs). Amazon VPC Lattice interconnects your microservices and legacy services within a logical boundary, so that you can discover and manage them more efficiently. For more information, see the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide
